<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.affinity.nodeAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.affinity.nodeAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">array</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding &ldquo;weight&rdquo; to the sum if the node matches the corresponding matchExpressions; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.affinity.nodeAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution[*]">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.affinity.nodeAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution[*]</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="property-body">

<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Describes pod affinity scheduling rules (e.g. co-locate this pod in the same node, zone, etc. as some other pod(s)).</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.affinity.podAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.affinity.podAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">array</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding &ldquo;weight&rdquo; to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.affinity.podAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution[*]">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.affinity.podAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution[*]</h3>
</div>

<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The weights of all of the matched WeightedPodAffinityTerm fields are added per-node to find the most preferred node(s)</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

When there are multiple elements, the lists of nodes corresponding to each podAffinityTerm are intersected, i.e. all terms must be satisfied.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property-description">

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.affinity.podAntiAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.affinity.podAntiAffinity.preferredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">array</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The scheduler will prefer to schedule pods to nodes that satisfy the anti-affinity expressions specified by this field, but it may choose a node that violates one or more of the expressions. The node that is most preferred is the one with the greatest sum of weights, i.e. for each node that meets all of the scheduling requirements (resource request, requiredDuringScheduling anti-affinity expressions, etc.), compute a sum by iterating through the elements of this field and adding &ldquo;weight&rdquo; to the sum if the node has pods which matches the corresponding podAffinityTerm; the node(s) with the highest sum are the most preferred.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Cannot be updated. </div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>PreStop is called immediately before a container is terminated due to an API request or management event such as liveness/startup probe failure, preemption, resource contention, etc. The handler is not called if the container crashes or exits. The Pod&rsquo;s termination grace period countdown begins before the PreStop hook is executed. Regardless of the outcome of the handler, the container will eventually terminate within the Pod&rsquo;s termination grace period (unless delayed by finalizers). Other management of the container blocks until the hook completes or until the termination grace period is reached. More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/container-lifecycle-hooks/#container-hooks">https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/container-lifecycle-hooks/#container-hooks</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Optional duration in seconds the pod needs to terminate gracefully upon probe failure. The grace period is the duration in seconds after the processes running in the pod are sent a termination signal and the time when the processes are forcibly halted with a kill signal. Set this value longer than the expected cleanup time for your process. If this value is nil, the pod&rsquo;s terminationGracePeriodSeconds will be used. Otherwise, this value overrides the value provided by the pod spec. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates stop immediately via the kill signal (no opportunity to shut down). This is a beta field and requires enabling ProbeTerminationGracePeriod feature gate. Minimum value is 1. spec.terminationGracePeriodSeconds is used if unset.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>

<p>Compute Resources required by this container. Cannot be updated. More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/">https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].resources.limits">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].resources.limits</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Limits describes the maximum amount of compute resources allowed. More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/">https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].resources.requests">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].resources.requests</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Requests describes the minimum amount of compute resources required. If Requests is omitted for a container, it defaults to Limits if that is explicitly specified, otherwise to an implementation-defined value. More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/">https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>SecurityContext defines the security options the container should be run with. If set, the fields of SecurityContext override the equivalent fields of PodSecurityContext. More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/security-context/">https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/security-context/</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>AllowPrivilegeEscalation controls whether a process can gain more privileges than its parent process. This bool directly controls if the no_new_privs flag will be set on the container process. AllowPrivilegeEscalation is true always when the container is: 1) run as Privileged 2) has CAP_SYS_ADMIN Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The capabilities to add/drop when running containers. Defaults to the default set of capabilities granted by the container runtime. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">array</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Added capabilities</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-9">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add[*]">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add[*]</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Capability represent POSIX capabilities type</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">array</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Removed capabilities</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-9">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop[*]">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop[*]</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Capability represent POSIX capabilities type</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.privileged">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.privileged</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Run container in privileged mode. Processes in privileged containers are essentially equivalent to root on the host. Defaults to false. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.procMount">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.procMount</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>procMount denotes the type of proc mount to use for the containers. The default is DefaultProcMount which uses the container runtime defaults for readonly paths and masked paths. This requires the ProcMountType feature flag to be enabled. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Whether this container has a read-only root filesystem. Default is false. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.runAsGroup">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.runAsGroup</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The GID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Uses runtime default if unset. May also be set in PodSecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.runAsNonRoot">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.runAsNonRoot</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Indicates that the container must run as a non-root user. If true, the Kubelet will validate the image at runtime to ensure that it does not run as UID 0 (root) and fail to start the container if it does. If unset or false, no such validation will be performed. May also be set in PodSecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.runAsUser">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.runAsUser</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The UID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to user specified in image metadata if unspecified. May also be set in PodSecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The SELinux context to be applied to the container. If unspecified, the container runtime will allocate a random SELinux context for each container.  May also be set in PodSecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.level">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.level</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Level is SELinux level label that applies to the container.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.role">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.role</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Role is a SELinux role label that applies to the container.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.type">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.type</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Type is a SELinux type label that applies to the container.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.user">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.user</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>User is a SELinux user label that applies to the container.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The seccomp options to use by this container. If seccomp options are provided at both the pod &amp; container level, the container options override the pod options. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile.localhostProfile">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile.localhostProfile</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>localhostProfile indicates a profile defined in a file on the node should be used. The profile must be preconfigured on the node to work. Must be a descending path, relative to the kubelet&rsquo;s configured seccomp profile location. Must only be set if type is &ldquo;Localhost&rdquo;.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile.type">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile.type</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>type indicates which kind of seccomp profile will be applied. Valid options are:
 Localhost - a profile defined in a file on the node should be used. RuntimeDefault - the container runtime default profile should be used. Unconfined - no profile should be applied.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The Windows specific settings applied to all containers. If unspecified, the options from the PodSecurityContext will be used. If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is linux.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.gmsaCredentialSpec">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.gmsaCredentialSpec</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>GMSACredentialSpec is where the GMSA admission webhook (<a href="https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/windows-gmsa">https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/windows-gmsa</a>) inlines the contents of the GMSA credential spec named by the GMSACredentialSpecName field.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.gmsaCredentialSpecName">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.gmsaCredentialSpecName</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>GMSACredentialSpecName is the name of the GMSA credential spec to use.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.hostProcess">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.hostProcess</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>HostProcess determines if a container should be run as a &lsquo;Host Process&rsquo; container. This field is alpha-level and will only be honored by components that enable the WindowsHostProcessContainers feature flag. Setting this field without the feature flag will result in errors when validating the Pod. All of a Pod&rsquo;s containers must have the same effective HostProcess value (it is not allowed to have a mix of HostProcess containers and non-HostProcess containers).  In addition, if HostProcess is true then HostNetwork must also be set to true.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.runAsUserName">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.runAsUserName</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The UserName in Windows to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to the user specified in image metadata if unspecified. May also be set in PodSecurityContext. If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>StartupProbe indicates that the Pod has successfully initialized. If specified, no other probes are executed until this completes successfully. If this probe fails, the Pod will be restarted, just as if the livenessProbe failed. This can be used to provide different probe parameters at the beginning of a Pod&rsquo;s lifecycle, when it might take a long time to load data or warm a cache, than during steady-state operation. This cannot be updated. More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes">https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.exec">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.exec</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Exec specifies the action to take.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.exec.command">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.exec.command</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">array</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Command is the command line to execute inside the container, the working directory for the command  is root (&lsquo;/&rsquo;) in the container&rsquo;s filesystem. The command is simply exec&rsquo;d, it is not run inside a shell, so traditional shell instructions (&lsquo;|&rsquo;, etc) won&rsquo;t work. To use a shell, you need to explicitly call out to that shell. Exit status of 0 is treated as live/healthy and non-zero is unhealthy.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-9">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.exec.command[*]">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.exec.command[*]</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.failureThreshold">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.failureThreshold</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded. Defaults to 3. Minimum value is 1.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.grpc">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.grpc</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>GRPC specifies an action involving a GRPC port. This is a beta field and requires enabling GRPCContainerProbe feature gate.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.grpc.port">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.grpc.port</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Port number of the gRPC service. Number must be in the range 1 to 65535.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.grpc.service">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.grpc.service</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Service is the name of the service to place in the gRPC HealthCheckRequest (see <a href="https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/health-checking.md">https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/health-checking.md</a>).
 If this is not specified, the default behavior is defined by gRPC.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.httpGet">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.httpGet</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>HTTPGet specifies the http request to perform.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.host">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.host</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Host name to connect to, defaults to the pod IP. You probably want to set &ldquo;Host&rdquo; in httpHeaders instead.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.httpHeaders">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.httpHeaders</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">array</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Custom headers to set in the request. HTTP allows repeated headers.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.terminationGracePeriodSeconds">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.terminationGracePeriodSeconds</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Optional duration in seconds the pod needs to terminate gracefully upon probe failure. The grace period is the duration in seconds after the processes running in the pod are sent a termination signal and the time when the processes are forcibly halted with a kill signal. Set this value longer than the expected cleanup time for your process. If this value is nil, the pod&rsquo;s terminationGracePeriodSeconds will be used. Otherwise, this value overrides the value provided by the pod spec. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates stop immediately via the kill signal (no opportunity to shut down). This is a beta field and requires enabling ProbeTerminationGracePeriod feature gate. Minimum value is 1. spec.terminationGracePeriodSeconds is used if unset.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.timeoutSeconds">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].startupProbe.timeoutSeconds</h3>
</div>

<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Number of seconds after which the probe times out. Defaults to 1 second. Minimum value is 1. More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes">https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].stdin">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].stdin</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Whether this container should allocate a buffer for stdin in the container runtime. If this is not set, reads from stdin in the container will always result in EOF. Default is false.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].stdinOnce">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].stdinOnce</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Whether the container runtime should close the stdin channel after it has been opened by a single attach. When stdin is true the stdin stream will remain open across multiple attach sessions. If stdinOnce is set to true, stdin is opened on container start, is empty until the first client attaches to stdin, and then remains open and accepts data until the client disconnects, at which time stdin is closed and remains closed until the container is restarted. If this flag is false, a container processes that reads from stdin will never receive an EOF. Default is false</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].terminationMessagePath">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].terminationMessagePath</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Optional: Path at which the file to which the container&rsquo;s termination message will be written is mounted into the container&rsquo;s filesystem. Message written is intended to be brief final status, such as an assertion failure message. Will be truncated by the node if greater than 4096 bytes. The total message length across all containers will be limited to 12kb. Defaults to /dev/termination-log. Cannot be updated.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].terminationMessagePolicy">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].terminationMessagePolicy</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Indicate how the termination message should be populated. File will use the contents of terminationMessagePath to populate the container status message on both success and failure. FallbackToLogsOnError will use the last chunk of container log output if the termination message file is empty and the container exited with an error. The log output is limited to 2048 bytes or 80 lines, whichever is smaller. Defaults to File. Cannot be updated.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].tty">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.containers[*].tty</h3>

<div class="property depth-8">

<div class="property depth-8">

Behaves similarly to SubPath but environment variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the container&rsquo;s environment. Defaults to &ldquo;&rdquo; (volume&rsquo;s root). <div class="property depth-6">

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">

</div>

<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">array</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Envs defines environment variables for Kafka broker Pods. Adding the &ldquo;+&rdquo; prefix to the name prepends the value to that environment variable instead of overwriting it. Add the &ldquo;+&rdquo; suffix to append.</p>

</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.envs[*]">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.envs[*]</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.envs[*].name">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.envs[*].name</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Name of the environment variable. Must be a C_IDENTIFIER.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.envs[*].value">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.envs[*].value</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the previously defined environment variables in the container and any service environment variables. If a variable cannot be resolved, the reference in the input string will be unchanged. Double $$ are reduced to a single $, which allows for escaping the $(VAR_NAME) syntax: i.e. &ldquo;$$(VAR_NAME)&rdquo; will produce the string literal &ldquo;$(VAR_NAME)&rdquo;. Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Defaults to &ldquo;&rdquo;.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].readinessProbe.terminationGracePeriodSeconds">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].readinessProbe.terminationGracePeriodSeconds</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Optional duration in seconds the pod needs to terminate gracefully upon probe failure. The grace period is the duration in seconds after the processes running in the pod are sent a termination signal and the time when the processes are forcibly halted with a kill signal. Set this value longer than the expected cleanup time for your process. If this value is nil, the pod&rsquo;s terminationGracePeriodSeconds will be used. Otherwise, this value overrides the value provided by the pod spec. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates stop immediately via the kill signal (no opportunity to shut down). This is a beta field and requires enabling ProbeTerminationGracePeriod feature gate. Minimum value is 1. spec.terminationGracePeriodSeconds is used if unset.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].readinessProbe.timeoutSeconds">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].readinessProbe.timeoutSeconds</h3>

<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

</div>
</div>

If Requests is omitted for a container, it defaults to Limits if that is explicitly specified, otherwise to an implementation-defined value. More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/">https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/</a></p>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">

<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>SecurityContext defines the security options the container should be run with. If set, the fields of SecurityContext override the equivalent fields of PodSecurityContext. More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/security-context/">https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/configure-pod-container/security-context/</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation</h3>
</div>

<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>AllowPrivilegeEscalation controls whether a process can gain more privileges than its parent process. This bool directly controls if the no_new_privs flag will be set on the container process. AllowPrivilegeEscalation is true always when the container is: 1) run as Privileged 2) has CAP_SYS_ADMIN Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property-header">

<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.privileged">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.privileged</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Run container in privileged mode. Processes in privileged containers are essentially equivalent to root on the host. Defaults to false. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.procMount">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.procMount</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>procMount denotes the type of proc mount to use for the containers. The default is DefaultProcMount which uses the container runtime defaults for readonly paths and masked paths. This requires the ProcMountType feature flag to be enabled. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Whether this container has a read-only root filesystem. Default is false. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.runAsGroup">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.runAsGroup</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The GID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Uses runtime default if unset. May also be set in PodSecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.runAsNonRoot">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.runAsNonRoot</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Indicates that the container must run as a non-root user. If true, the Kubelet will validate the image at runtime to ensure that it does not run as UID 0 (root) and fail to start the container if it does. If unset or false, no such validation will be performed. May also be set in PodSecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.runAsUser">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.runAsUser</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The UID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to user specified in image metadata if unspecified. May also be set in PodSecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions</h3>
</div>

<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The SELinux context to be applied to the container. If unspecified, the container runtime will allocate a random SELinux context for each container.  May also be set in PodSecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.level">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.level</h3>

<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.role">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.role</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.type">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.type</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Type is a SELinux type label that applies to the container.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.user">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.user</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>User is a SELinux user label that applies to the container.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile</h3>

<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The seccomp options to use by this container. If seccomp options are provided at both the pod &amp; container level, the container options override the pod options. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile.localhostProfile">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile.localhostProfile</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>localhostProfile indicates a profile defined in a file on the node should be used. The profile must be preconfigured on the node to work. Must be a descending path, relative to the kubelet&rsquo;s configured seccomp profile location. Must only be set if type is &ldquo;Localhost&rdquo;.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile.type">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile.type</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>type indicates which kind of seccomp profile will be applied. Valid options are:
 Localhost - a profile defined in a file on the node should be used. RuntimeDefault - the container runtime default profile should be used. Unconfined - no profile should be applied.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The Windows specific settings applied to all containers. If unspecified, the options from the PodSecurityContext will be used. If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is linux.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.gmsaCredentialSpec">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.gmsaCredentialSpec</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>GMSACredentialSpec is where the GMSA admission webhook (<a href="https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/windows-gmsa">https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/windows-gmsa</a>) inlines the contents of the GMSA credential spec named by the GMSACredentialSpecName field.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.gmsaCredentialSpecName">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.gmsaCredentialSpecName</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>GMSACredentialSpecName is the name of the GMSA credential spec to use.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.hostProcess">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.hostProcess</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>HostProcess determines if a container should be run as a &lsquo;Host Process&rsquo; container. This field is alpha-level and will only be honored by components that enable the WindowsHostProcessContainers feature flag. Setting this field without the feature flag will result in errors when validating the Pod. All of a Pod&rsquo;s containers must have the same effective HostProcess value (it is not allowed to have a mix of HostProcess containers and non-HostProcess containers).  In addition, if HostProcess is true then HostNetwork must also be set to true.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.runAsUserName">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.runAsUserName</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The UserName in Windows to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to the user specified in image metadata if unspecified. May also be set in PodSecurityContext. If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>StartupProbe indicates that the Pod has successfully initialized. If specified, no other probes are executed until this completes successfully. If this probe fails, the Pod will be restarted, just as if the livenessProbe failed. This can be used to provide different probe parameters at the beginning of a Pod&rsquo;s lifecycle, when it might take a long time to load data or warm a cache, than during steady-state operation. This cannot be updated. More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes">https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.exec">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.exec</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Exec specifies the action to take.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.exec.command">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.exec.command</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">array</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Command is the command line to execute inside the container, the working directory for the command  is root (&lsquo;/&rsquo;) in the container&rsquo;s filesystem. The command is simply exec&rsquo;d, it is not run inside a shell, so traditional shell instructions (&lsquo;|&rsquo;, etc) won&rsquo;t work. To use a shell, you need to explicitly call out to that shell. Exit status of 0 is treated as live/healthy and non-zero is unhealthy.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-9">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.exec.command[*]">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.exec.command[*]</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.failureThreshold">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.failureThreshold</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded. Defaults to 3. Minimum value is 1.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.grpc">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.grpc</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>GRPC specifies an action involving a GRPC port. This is a beta field and requires enabling GRPCContainerProbe feature gate.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.grpc.port">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.grpc.port</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Port number of the gRPC service. Number must be in the range 1 to 65535.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.grpc.service">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.grpc.service</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Service is the name of the service to place in the gRPC HealthCheckRequest (see <a href="https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/health-checking.md">https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/health-checking.md</a>).
 If this is not specified, the default behavior is defined by gRPC.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>HTTPGet specifies the http request to perform.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.host">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.host</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Host name to connect to, defaults to the pod IP. You probably want to set &ldquo;Host&rdquo; in httpHeaders instead.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.httpHeaders">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.httpHeaders</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">array</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Custom headers to set in the request. HTTP allows repeated headers.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-9">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.httpHeaders[*]">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.httpHeaders[*]</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>HTTPHeader describes a custom header to be used in HTTP probes</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-10">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.httpHeaders[*].name">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.httpHeaders[*].name</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The header field name</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-10">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.httpHeaders[*].value">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.httpHeaders[*].value</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The header field value</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.path">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.path</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Path to access on the HTTP server.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.port">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.port</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">

<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Name or number of the port to access on the container. Number must be in the range 1 to 65535. Name must be an IANA_SVC_NAME.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.scheme">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.scheme</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Scheme to use for connecting to the host. Defaults to HTTP.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.initialDelaySeconds">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.initialDelaySeconds</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Number of seconds after the container has started before liveness probes are initiated. More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes">https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.periodSeconds">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.periodSeconds</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>How often (in seconds) to perform the probe. Default to 10 seconds. Minimum value is 1.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.successThreshold">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.successThreshold</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed. Defaults to 1. Must be 1 for liveness and startup. Minimum value is 1.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.tcpSocket">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.tcpSocket</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>TCPSocket specifies an action involving a TCP port.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.tcpSocket.host">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.tcpSocket.host</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Optional: Host name to connect to, defaults to the pod IP.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.tcpSocket.port">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.tcpSocket.port</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">

<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Number or name of the port to access on the container. Number must be in the range 1 to 65535. Name must be an IANA_SVC_NAME.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.terminationGracePeriodSeconds">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.terminationGracePeriodSeconds</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Optional duration in seconds the pod needs to terminate gracefully upon probe failure. The grace period is the duration in seconds after the processes running in the pod are sent a termination signal and the time when the processes are forcibly halted with a kill signal. Set this value longer than the expected cleanup time for your process. If this value is nil, the pod&rsquo;s terminationGracePeriodSeconds will be used. Otherwise, this value overrides the value provided by the pod spec. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates stop immediately via the kill signal (no opportunity to shut down). This is a beta field and requires enabling ProbeTerminationGracePeriod feature gate. Minimum value is 1. spec.terminationGracePeriodSeconds is used if unset.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.timeoutSeconds">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.timeoutSeconds</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Number of seconds after which the probe times out. Defaults to 1 second. Minimum value is 1. More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes">https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].stdin">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].stdin</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Whether this container should allocate a buffer for stdin in the container runtime. If this is not set, reads from stdin in the container will always result in EOF. Default is false.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].stdinOnce">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].stdinOnce</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Whether the container runtime should close the stdin channel after it has been opened by a single attach. When stdin is true the stdin stream will remain open across multiple attach sessions. If stdinOnce is set to true, stdin is opened on container start, is empty until the first client attaches to stdin, and then remains open and accepts data until the client disconnects, at which time stdin is closed and remains closed until the container is restarted. If this flag is false, a container processes that reads from stdin will never receive an EOF. Default is false</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].terminationMessagePath">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].terminationMessagePath</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Optional: Path at which the file to which the container&rsquo;s termination message will be written is mounted into the container&rsquo;s filesystem. Message written is intended to be brief final status, such as an assertion failure message. Will be truncated by the node if greater than 4096 bytes. The total message length across all containers will be limited to 12kb. Defaults to /dev/termination-log. Cannot be updated.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].terminationMessagePolicy">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].terminationMessagePolicy</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Indicate how the termination message should be populated. File will use the contents of terminationMessagePath to populate the container status message on both success and failure. FallbackToLogsOnError will use the last chunk of container log output if the termination message file is empty and the container exited with an error. The log output is limited to 2048 bytes or 80 lines, whichever is smaller. Defaults to File. Cannot be updated.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].tty">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].tty</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Whether this container should allocate a TTY for itself, also requires &lsquo;stdin&rsquo; to be true. Default is false.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].volumeDevices">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].volumeDevices</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">array</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>volumeDevices is the list of block devices to be used by the container.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].volumeDevices[*]">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.initContainers[*].volumeDevices[*]</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>volumeDevice describes a mapping of a raw block device within a container.</p>

</div>

Behaves similarly to SubPath but environment variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the container&rsquo;s environment. Defaults to &ldquo;&rdquo; (volume&rsquo;s root). SubPathExpr and SubPath are mutually exclusive.</p>

</div>
</div>

<span class="property-type">string</span>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.nodePortExternalIP">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.nodePortExternalIP</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>External listeners that use NodePort type service to expose the broker outside the Kubernetes clusterT and their external IP to advertise Kafka broker external listener. The external IP value is ignored in case of external listeners that use LoadBalancer type service to expose the broker outside the Kubernetes cluster. Also, when &ldquo;hostnameOverride&rdquo; field of the external listener is set it will override the broker&rsquo;s external listener advertise address according to the description of the &ldquo;hostnameOverride&rdquo; field.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.nodePortNodeAddressType">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.nodePortNodeAddressType</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>When &ldquo;hostNameOverride&rdquo; and brokerConfig.nodePortExternalIP are empty and NodePort access method is selected for an external listener the NodePortNodeAdddressType defines the Kafka broker&rsquo;s Kubernetes node&rsquo;s address type that shall be used in the advertised.listeners property. <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/architecture/nodes/#addresses">https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/architecture/nodes/#addresses</a> The NodePortNodeAddressType&rsquo;s possible values can be Hostname, ExternalIP, InternalIP, InternalDNS,ExternalDNS</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.nodeSelector">.spec.brokers[*].brokerConfig.nodeSelector</h3>

<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>
