</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>AllowPrivilegeEscalation controls whether a process can gain more privileges than its parent process. This bool directly controls if the no_new_privs flag will be set on the container process. AllowPrivilegeEscalation is true always when the container is: 1) run as Privileged 2) has CAP_SYS_ADMIN Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.capabilities">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.capabilities</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The capabilities to add/drop when running containers. Defaults to the default set of capabilities granted by the container runtime. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">array</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Added capabilities</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add[*]">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.capabilities.add[*]</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Capability represent POSIX capabilities type</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">array</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Removed capabilities</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop[*]">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.capabilities.drop[*]</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Capability represent POSIX capabilities type</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.privileged">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.privileged</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Run container in privileged mode. Processes in privileged containers are essentially equivalent to root on the host. Defaults to false. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.procMount">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.procMount</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>procMount denotes the type of proc mount to use for the containers. The default is DefaultProcMount which uses the container runtime defaults for readonly paths and masked paths. This requires the ProcMountType feature flag to be enabled. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.readOnlyRootFilesystem</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Whether this container has a read-only root filesystem. Default is false. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.runAsGroup">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.runAsGroup</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The GID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Uses runtime default if unset. May also be set in PodSecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.runAsNonRoot">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.runAsNonRoot</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Indicates that the container must run as a non-root user. If true, the Kubelet will validate the image at runtime to ensure that it does not run as UID 0 (root) and fail to start the container if it does. If unset or false, no such validation will be performed. May also be set in PodSecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.runAsUser">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.runAsUser</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The UID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to user specified in image metadata if unspecified. May also be set in PodSecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The SELinux context to be applied to the container. If unspecified, the container runtime will allocate a random SELinux context for each container.  May also be set in PodSecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.level">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.level</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Level is SELinux level label that applies to the container.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.role">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.role</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Role is a SELinux role label that applies to the container.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.type">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.type</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Type is a SELinux type label that applies to the container.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.user">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seLinuxOptions.user</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>User is a SELinux user label that applies to the container.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The seccomp options to use by this container. If seccomp options are provided at both the pod &amp; container level, the container options override the pod options. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile.localhostProfile">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile.localhostProfile</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>localhostProfile indicates a profile defined in a file on the node should be used. The profile must be preconfigured on the node to work. Must be a descending path, relative to the kubelet&rsquo;s configured seccomp profile location. Must only be set if type is &ldquo;Localhost&rdquo;.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile.type">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.seccompProfile.type</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>type indicates which kind of seccomp profile will be applied. Valid options are:
 Localhost - a profile defined in a file on the node should be used. RuntimeDefault - the container runtime default profile should be used. Unconfined - no profile should be applied.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The Windows specific settings applied to all containers. If unspecified, the options from the PodSecurityContext will be used. If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is linux.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.gmsaCredentialSpec">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.gmsaCredentialSpec</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>GMSACredentialSpec is where the GMSA admission webhook (<a href="https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/windows-gmsa">https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/windows-gmsa</a>) inlines the contents of the GMSA credential spec named by the GMSACredentialSpecName field.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.gmsaCredentialSpecName">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.gmsaCredentialSpecName</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>GMSACredentialSpecName is the name of the GMSA credential spec to use.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.hostProcess">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.hostProcess</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>HostProcess determines if a container should be run as a &lsquo;Host Process&rsquo; container. This field is alpha-level and will only be honored by components that enable the WindowsHostProcessContainers feature flag. Setting this field without the feature flag will result in errors when validating the Pod. All of a Pod&rsquo;s containers must have the same effective HostProcess value (it is not allowed to have a mix of HostProcess containers and non-HostProcess containers).  In addition, if HostProcess is true then HostNetwork must also be set to true.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.runAsUserName">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].securityContext.windowsOptions.runAsUserName</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The UserName in Windows to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to the user specified in image metadata if unspecified. May also be set in PodSecurityContext. If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>StartupProbe indicates that the Pod has successfully initialized. If specified, no other probes are executed until this completes successfully. If this probe fails, the Pod will be restarted, just as if the livenessProbe failed. This can be used to provide different probe parameters at the beginning of a Pod&rsquo;s lifecycle, when it might take a long time to load data or warm a cache, than during steady-state operation. This cannot be updated. More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes">https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.exec">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.exec</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Exec specifies the action to take.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.exec.command">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.exec.command</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">array</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Command is the command line to execute inside the container, the working directory for the command  is root (&lsquo;/&rsquo;) in the container&rsquo;s filesystem. The command is simply exec&rsquo;d, it is not run inside a shell, so traditional shell instructions (&lsquo;|&rsquo;, etc) won&rsquo;t work. To use a shell, you need to explicitly call out to that shell. Exit status of 0 is treated as live/healthy and non-zero is unhealthy.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.exec.command[*]">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.exec.command[*]</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.failureThreshold">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.failureThreshold</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded. Defaults to 3. Minimum value is 1.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.grpc">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.grpc</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>GRPC specifies an action involving a GRPC port. This is a beta field and requires enabling GRPCContainerProbe feature gate.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.grpc.port">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.grpc.port</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Port number of the gRPC service. Number must be in the range 1 to 65535.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.grpc.service">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.grpc.service</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Service is the name of the service to place in the gRPC HealthCheckRequest (see <a href="https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/health-checking.md">https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/master/doc/health-checking.md</a>).
 If this is not specified, the default behavior is defined by gRPC.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>HTTPGet specifies the http request to perform.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.host">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.host</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Host name to connect to, defaults to the pod IP. You probably want to set &ldquo;Host&rdquo; in httpHeaders instead.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.httpHeaders">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.httpHeaders</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">array</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Custom headers to set in the request. HTTP allows repeated headers.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-7">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.httpHeaders[*]">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.httpHeaders[*]</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>HTTPHeader describes a custom header to be used in HTTP probes</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.httpHeaders[*].name">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.httpHeaders[*].name</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The header field name</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-8">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.httpHeaders[*].value">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.httpHeaders[*].value</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The header field value</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.path">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.path</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Path to access on the HTTP server.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.port">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.port</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">

<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Name or number of the port to access on the container. Number must be in the range 1 to 65535. Name must be an IANA_SVC_NAME.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.scheme">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.httpGet.scheme</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Scheme to use for connecting to the host. Defaults to HTTP.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.initialDelaySeconds">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.initialDelaySeconds</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Number of seconds after the container has started before liveness probes are initiated. More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes">https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.periodSeconds">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.periodSeconds</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>How often (in seconds) to perform the probe. Default to 10 seconds. Minimum value is 1.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.successThreshold">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.successThreshold</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed. Defaults to 1. Must be 1 for liveness and startup. Minimum value is 1.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.tcpSocket">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.tcpSocket</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>TCPSocket specifies an action involving a TCP port.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.tcpSocket.host">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.tcpSocket.host</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Optional: Host name to connect to, defaults to the pod IP.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.tcpSocket.port">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.tcpSocket.port</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">

<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Number or name of the port to access on the container. Number must be in the range 1 to 65535. Name must be an IANA_SVC_NAME.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.terminationGracePeriodSeconds">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.terminationGracePeriodSeconds</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Optional duration in seconds the pod needs to terminate gracefully upon probe failure. The grace period is the duration in seconds after the processes running in the pod are sent a termination signal and the time when the processes are forcibly halted with a kill signal. Set this value longer than the expected cleanup time for your process. If this value is nil, the pod&rsquo;s terminationGracePeriodSeconds will be used. Otherwise, this value overrides the value provided by the pod spec. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates stop immediately via the kill signal (no opportunity to shut down). This is a beta field and requires enabling ProbeTerminationGracePeriod feature gate. Minimum value is 1. spec.terminationGracePeriodSeconds is used if unset.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.timeoutSeconds">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].startupProbe.timeoutSeconds</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Number of seconds after which the probe times out. Defaults to 1 second. Minimum value is 1. More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes">https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].stdin">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].stdin</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Whether this container should allocate a buffer for stdin in the container runtime. If this is not set, reads from stdin in the container will always result in EOF. Default is false.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].stdinOnce">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].stdinOnce</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Whether the container runtime should close the stdin channel after it has been opened by a single attach. When stdin is true the stdin stream will remain open across multiple attach sessions. If stdinOnce is set to true, stdin is opened on container start, is empty until the first client attaches to stdin, and then remains open and accepts data until the client disconnects, at which time stdin is closed and remains closed until the container is restarted. If this flag is false, a container processes that reads from stdin will never receive an EOF. Default is false</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].terminationMessagePath">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].terminationMessagePath</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Optional: Path at which the file to which the container&rsquo;s termination message will be written is mounted into the container&rsquo;s filesystem. Message written is intended to be brief final status, such as an assertion failure message. Will be truncated by the node if greater than 4096 bytes. The total message length across all containers will be limited to 12kb. Defaults to /dev/termination-log. Cannot be updated.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].terminationMessagePolicy">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].terminationMessagePolicy</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Indicate how the termination message should be populated. File will use the contents of terminationMessagePath to populate the container status message on both success and failure. FallbackToLogsOnError will use the last chunk of container log output if the termination message file is empty and the container exited with an error. The log output is limited to 2048 bytes or 80 lines, whichever is smaller. Defaults to File. Cannot be updated.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].tty">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].tty</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Whether this container should allocate a TTY for itself, also requires &lsquo;stdin&rsquo; to be true. Default is false.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeDevices">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeDevices</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">array</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>volumeDevices is the list of block devices to be used by the container.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeDevices[*]">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeDevices[*]</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>volumeDevice describes a mapping of a raw block device within a container.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeDevices[*].devicePath">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeDevices[*].devicePath</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>devicePath is the path inside of the container that the device will be mapped to.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeDevices[*].name">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeDevices[*].name</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>name must match the name of a persistentVolumeClaim in the pod</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeMounts">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeMounts</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">array</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Pod volumes to mount into the container&rsquo;s filesystem. Cannot be updated.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeMounts[*]">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeMounts[*]</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>VolumeMount describes a mounting of a Volume within a container.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeMounts[*].mountPath">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeMounts[*].mountPath</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Path within the container at which the volume should be mounted.  Must not contain &lsquo;:&rsquo;.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeMounts[*].mountPropagation">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeMounts[*].mountPropagation</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>mountPropagation determines how mounts are propagated from the host to container and the other way around. When not set, MountPropagationNone is used. This field is beta in 1.10.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeMounts[*].name">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeMounts[*].name</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>This must match the Name of a Volume.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeMounts[*].readOnly">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeMounts[*].readOnly</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Mounted read-only if true, read-write otherwise (false or unspecified). Defaults to false.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeMounts[*].subPath">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeMounts[*].subPath</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Path within the volume from which the container&rsquo;s volume should be mounted. Defaults to &ldquo;&rdquo; (volume&rsquo;s root).</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeMounts[*].subPathExpr">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].volumeMounts[*].subPathExpr</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Expanded path within the volume from which the container&rsquo;s volume should be mounted. Behaves similarly to SubPath but environment variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the container&rsquo;s environment. Defaults to &ldquo;&rdquo; (volume&rsquo;s root). SubPathExpr and SubPath are mutually exclusive.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].workingDir">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.initContainers[*].workingDir</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Container&rsquo;s working directory. If not specified, the container runtime&rsquo;s default will be used, which might be configured in the container image. Cannot be updated.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-2">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.log4jConfig">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.log4jConfig</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-2">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.nodeSelector">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.nodeSelector</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-2">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>PodSecurityContext holds pod-level security attributes and common container settings. Some fields are also present in container.securityContext.  Field values of container.securityContext take precedence over field values of PodSecurityContext.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-3">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.fsGroup">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.fsGroup</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>A special supplemental group that applies to all containers in a pod. Some volume types allow the Kubelet to change the ownership of that volume to be owned by the pod:
 1. The owning GID will be the FSGroup 2. The setgid bit is set (new files created in the volume will be owned by FSGroup) 3. The permission bits are OR&rsquo;d with rw-rw&mdash;-
 If unset, the Kubelet will not modify the ownership and permissions of any volume. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-3">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.fsGroupChangePolicy">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.fsGroupChangePolicy</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>fsGroupChangePolicy defines behavior of changing ownership and permission of the volume before being exposed inside Pod. This field will only apply to volume types which support fsGroup based ownership(and permissions). It will have no effect on ephemeral volume types such as: secret, configmaps and emptydir. Valid values are &ldquo;OnRootMismatch&rdquo; and &ldquo;Always&rdquo;. If not specified, &ldquo;Always&rdquo; is used. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-3">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.runAsGroup">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.runAsGroup</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The GID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Uses runtime default if unset. May also be set in SecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence for that container. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-3">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.runAsNonRoot">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.runAsNonRoot</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Indicates that the container must run as a non-root user. If true, the Kubelet will validate the image at runtime to ensure that it does not run as UID 0 (root) and fail to start the container if it does. If unset or false, no such validation will be performed. May also be set in SecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-3">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.runAsUser">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.runAsUser</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The UID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to user specified in image metadata if unspecified. May also be set in SecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence for that container. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-3">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.seLinuxOptions">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.seLinuxOptions</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The SELinux context to be applied to all containers. If unspecified, the container runtime will allocate a random SELinux context for each container.  May also be set in SecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence for that container. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.seLinuxOptions.level">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.seLinuxOptions.level</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Level is SELinux level label that applies to the container.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.seLinuxOptions.role">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.seLinuxOptions.role</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Role is a SELinux role label that applies to the container.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.seLinuxOptions.type">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.seLinuxOptions.type</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Type is a SELinux type label that applies to the container.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.seLinuxOptions.user">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.seLinuxOptions.user</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>User is a SELinux user label that applies to the container.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-3">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.seccompProfile">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.seccompProfile</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The seccomp options to use by the containers in this pod. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.seccompProfile.localhostProfile">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.seccompProfile.localhostProfile</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>localhostProfile indicates a profile defined in a file on the node should be used. The profile must be preconfigured on the node to work. Must be a descending path, relative to the kubelet&rsquo;s configured seccomp profile location. Must only be set if type is &ldquo;Localhost&rdquo;.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.seccompProfile.type">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.seccompProfile.type</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is linux.</p>

<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.windowsOptions.hostProcess">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.podSecurityContext.windowsOptions.hostProcess</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>HostProcess determines if a container should be run as a &lsquo;Host Process&rsquo; container. This field is alpha-level and will only be honored by components that enable the WindowsHostProcessContainers feature flag. Setting this field without the feature flag will result in errors when validating the Pod. All of a Pod&rsquo;s containers must have the same effective HostProcess value (it is not allowed to have a mix of HostProcess containers and non-HostProcess containers).  In addition, if HostProcess is true then HostNetwork must also be set to true.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">

</div>

</div>

AllowPrivilegeEscalation is true always when the container is: 1) run as Privileged 2) has CAP_SYS_ADMIN Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>procMount denotes the type of proc mount to use for the containers. The default is DefaultProcMount which uses the container runtime defaults for readonly paths and masked paths. This requires the ProcMountType feature flag to be enabled. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Whether this container has a read-only root filesystem. Default is false. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-3">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.securityContext.runAsGroup">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.securityContext.runAsGroup</h3>

<span class="property-type">integer</span>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The GID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Uses runtime default if unset. May also be set in PodSecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Indicates that the container must run as a non-root user. If true, the Kubelet will validate the image at runtime to ensure that it does not run as UID 0 (root) and fail to start the container if it does. If unset or false, no such validation will be performed. May also be set in PodSecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-3">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.securityContext.runAsUser">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.securityContext.runAsUser</h3>

<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The UID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to user specified in image metadata if unspecified. May also be set in PodSecurityContext.  If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence. Note that this field cannot be set when spec.os.name is windows.</p>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-3">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.tolerations[*]">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.tolerations[*]</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>The pod this Toleration is attached to tolerates any taint that matches the triple <key,value,effect> using the matching operator <operator>.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.tolerations[*].effect">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.tolerations[*].effect</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Effect indicates the taint effect to match. Empty means match all taint effects. When specified, allowed values are NoSchedule, PreferNoSchedule and NoExecute.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.tolerations[*].key">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.tolerations[*].key</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Key is the taint key that the toleration applies to. Empty means match all taint keys. If the key is empty, operator must be Exists; this combination means to match all values and all keys.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.tolerations[*].operator">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.tolerations[*].operator</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Operator represents a key&rsquo;s relationship to the value. Valid operators are Exists and Equal. Defaults to Equal. Exists is equivalent to wildcard for value, so that a pod can tolerate all taints of a particular category.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.tolerations[*].tolerationSeconds">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.tolerations[*].tolerationSeconds</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>TolerationSeconds represents the period of time the toleration (which must be of effect NoExecute, otherwise this field is ignored) tolerates the taint. By default, it is not set, which means tolerate the taint forever (do not evict). Zero and negative values will be treated as 0 (evict immediately) by the system.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.tolerations[*].value">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.tolerations[*].value</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Value is the taint value the toleration matches to. If the operator is Exists, the value should be empty, otherwise just a regular string.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-2">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.topicConfig">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.topicConfig</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>TopicConfig holds info for topic configuration regarding partitions and replicationFactor</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-3">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.topicConfig.partitions">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.topicConfig.partitions</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-3">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.topicConfig.replicationFactor">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.topicConfig.replicationFactor</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-2">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumeMounts">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumeMounts</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">array</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>VolumeMounts define some extra Kubernetes Volume mounts for the CruiseControl Pods.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-3">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumeMounts[*]">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumeMounts[*]</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>VolumeMount describes a mounting of a Volume within a container.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumeMounts[*].mountPath">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumeMounts[*].mountPath</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Path within the container at which the volume should be mounted.  Must not contain &lsquo;:&rsquo;.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumeMounts[*].mountPropagation">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumeMounts[*].mountPropagation</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>mountPropagation determines how mounts are propagated from the host to container and the other way around. When not set, MountPropagationNone is used. This field is beta in 1.10.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumeMounts[*].name">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumeMounts[*].name</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>This must match the Name of a Volume.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumeMounts[*].readOnly">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumeMounts[*].readOnly</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Mounted read-only if true, read-write otherwise (false or unspecified). Defaults to false.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumeMounts[*].subPath">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumeMounts[*].subPath</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Path within the volume from which the container&rsquo;s volume should be mounted. Defaults to &ldquo;&rdquo; (volume&rsquo;s root).</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumeMounts[*].subPathExpr">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumeMounts[*].subPathExpr</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Expanded path within the volume from which the container&rsquo;s volume should be mounted. Behaves similarly to SubPath but environment variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the container&rsquo;s environment. Defaults to &ldquo;&rdquo; (volume&rsquo;s root). SubPathExpr and SubPath are mutually exclusive.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-2">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">array</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Volumes define some extra Kubernetes Volumes for the CruiseControl Pods.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-3">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*]">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*]</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Volume represents a named volume in a pod that may be accessed by any container in the pod.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].awsElasticBlockStore">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].awsElasticBlockStore</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>awsElasticBlockStore represents an AWS Disk resource that is attached to a kubelet&rsquo;s host machine and then exposed to the pod. More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore">https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].awsElasticBlockStore.fsType">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].awsElasticBlockStore.fsType</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>fsType is the filesystem type of the volume that you want to mount. Tip: Ensure that the filesystem type is supported by the host operating system. Examples: &ldquo;ext4&rdquo;, &ldquo;xfs&rdquo;, &ldquo;ntfs&rdquo;. Implicitly inferred to be &ldquo;ext4&rdquo; if unspecified. More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore">https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore</a> TODO: how do we prevent errors in the filesystem from compromising the machine</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].awsElasticBlockStore.partition">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].awsElasticBlockStore.partition</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">integer</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>partition is the partition in the volume that you want to mount. If omitted, the default is to mount by volume name. Examples: For volume /dev/sda1, you specify the partition as &ldquo;1&rdquo;. Similarly, the volume partition for /dev/sda is &ldquo;0&rdquo; (or you can leave the property empty).</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].awsElasticBlockStore.readOnly">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].awsElasticBlockStore.readOnly</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>readOnly value true will force the readOnly setting in VolumeMounts. More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore">https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].awsElasticBlockStore.volumeID">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].awsElasticBlockStore.volumeID</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>volumeID is unique ID of the persistent disk resource in AWS (Amazon EBS volume). More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore">https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureDisk">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureDisk</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>azureDisk represents an Azure Data Disk mount on the host and bind mount to the pod.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureDisk.cachingMode">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureDisk.cachingMode</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>cachingMode is the Host Caching mode: None, Read Only, Read Write.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureDisk.diskName">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureDisk.diskName</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>diskName is the Name of the data disk in the blob storage</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureDisk.diskURI">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureDisk.diskURI</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>diskURI is the URI of data disk in the blob storage</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureDisk.fsType">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureDisk.fsType</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>fsType is Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. &ldquo;ext4&rdquo;, &ldquo;xfs&rdquo;, &ldquo;ntfs&rdquo;. Implicitly inferred to be &ldquo;ext4&rdquo; if unspecified.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureDisk.kind">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureDisk.kind</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>kind expected values are Shared: multiple blob disks per storage account  Dedicated: single blob disk per storage account  Managed: azure managed data disk (only in managed availability set). defaults to shared</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureDisk.readOnly">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureDisk.readOnly</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>readOnly Defaults to false (read/write). ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureFile">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureFile</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>azureFile represents an Azure File Service mount on the host and bind mount to the pod.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureFile.readOnly">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureFile.readOnly</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>readOnly defaults to false (read/write). ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts.</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureFile.secretName">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureFile.secretName</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>secretName is the  name of secret that contains Azure Storage Account Name and Key</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureFile.shareName">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].azureFile.shareName</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>shareName is the azure share Name</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-4">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].cephfs">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].cephfs</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>cephFS represents a Ceph FS mount on the host that shares a pod&rsquo;s lifetime</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].cephfs.monitors">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].cephfs.monitors</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">array</span>
<span class="property-required">Required</span>
</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>monitors is Required: Monitors is a collection of Ceph monitors More info: <a href="https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/cephfs/README.md#how-to-use-it">https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/cephfs/README.md#how-to-use-it</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].cephfs.monitors[*]">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].cephfs.monitors[*]</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].cephfs.path">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].cephfs.path</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>path is Optional: Used as the mounted root, rather than the full Ceph tree, default is /</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].cephfs.readOnly">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].cephfs.readOnly</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">boolean</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>readOnly is Optional: Defaults to false (read/write). ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts. More info: <a href="https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/cephfs/README.md#how-to-use-it">https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/cephfs/README.md#how-to-use-it</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].cephfs.secretFile">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].cephfs.secretFile</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>secretFile is Optional: SecretFile is the path to key ring for User, default is /etc/ceph/user.secret More info: <a href="https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/cephfs/README.md#how-to-use-it">https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/cephfs/README.md#how-to-use-it</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].cephfs.secretRef">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].cephfs.secretRef</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">object</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>secretRef is Optional: SecretRef is reference to the authentication secret for User, default is empty. More info: <a href="https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/cephfs/README.md#how-to-use-it">https://examples.k8s.io/volumes/cephfs/README.md#how-to-use-it</a></p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-6">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].cephfs.secretRef.name">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].cephfs.secretRef.name</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

</div>

<div class="property-description">
<p>Name of the referent. More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names">https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names</a> TODO: Add other useful fields. apiVersion, kind, uid?</p>

</div>

</div>
</div>

<div class="property depth-5">
<div class="property-header">
<h3 id="v1beta1-.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].cephfs.user">.spec.cruiseControlConfig.volumes[*].cephfs.user</h3>
</div>
<div class="property-body">
<div class="property-meta">
<span class="property-type">string</span>

YAML accepts both octal and decimal values, JSON requires decimal values for mode bits. Defaults to 0644. Directories within the path are not affected by this setting. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.</p>

If specified, the listed keys will be projected into the specified paths, and unlisted keys will not be present. If a key is specified which is not present in the ConfigMap, the volume setup will error unless it is marked optional. Paths must be relative and may not contain the &lsquo;..&rsquo; path or start with &lsquo;..&rsquo;.</p>

The default is nil which means that the limit is undefined. More info: <a href="https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes/#emptydir">https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes/#emptydir</a></p>
